rename.from: FIX path should never be concatenated in verbose output = show full path
rename.to: Path should never be truncated in stats output

issue.title: [Feature request] Show full path/ Name during transfer

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
Hello,

during transfer the file Name are cut off... is it possible to add an mode to show the complete file Name?

Problem, when you are use long file names you can´t read witch file are in process...

Regards
Massaguana

If you've just got a question or aren't sure if you've found a bug then please use the [rclone forum](https://forum.rclone.org/) instead of filing an issue.

> What is your rclone version (eg output from `rclone -V`)
v1.35
> Which OS you are using and how many bits (eg Windows 7, 64 bit)
MacOS, CentOS7 64Bit
> Which cloud storage system are you using? (eg Google Drive)
GSuite Business
> The command you were trying to run (eg `rclone copy /tmp remote:tmp`)
rclone -v sync "path" "path"
> A log from the command with the `-vv` flag (eg output from `rclone -vv copy /tmp remote:tmp`)

body: I would like to see this too on -vv(v) passed options

Any word on this being added soon? 
It's kind of annoying have multiple files that end in the same format and not knowing exactly where the copy is at

going to +1 this also. I dont need the FULL path. But atleast the complete file name during the transfers. 

maybe using an option like --fullpath --filename to differentiate between displaying the Absolute path or just the full name of the file being uploaded/downloaded/checked etc.
I added a PR that’s allows arbitrary length file paths, and I’m using it successfully as a local patch right now.

issue.title: Fixes #1206 Supporting Arbitrary Stats Filename Lengths

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
Added a config option to specify the printed file name length for stats.

I didn't update the various documentation .md files because I figured you would want to change the flag text and or description wording.

body:
The new flag can be found  here

https://beta.rclone.org/v1.39-020-g6d333da6/ (uploaded in 15-30 mins)

It is called `--stats-file-name-length`
why not make this default behaviour? :)

@allanlaal The log output is supposed to look nice on the terminal that is why...

Anyway you can set `RCLONE_STATS_FILE_NAME_LENGTH=0` in your environment if you wish that to be on all the time.
other *nix commands don't truncate their output, that what `cut` is for ;)
